abstract: French government, in show of readiness and seeking to reassure citizens, deploys thousands of troops and police officers to guard sites that are perceived as vulnerable, including Jewish schools; moves recall atmosphere directly following the Sept 11 attacks in the United States, and play into emerging debate in Europe between civil liberties and security.
lead_paragraph: The authorities said that they would bolster security to protect potential targets of terrorism, putting in place one of the country’s biggest peacetime security operations.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Dan Bilefsky, Rukmini Callimachi and Laure Fourquet from Paris; Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome; Palko Karasz and Katrin Bennhold from London; and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.
byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and MAÏA de la BAUME

snippet: The authorities said that they would bolster security to protect potential targets of terrorism, putting in place one of the country’s biggest peacetime security operations.

headline.main: France Deploys Troops to Guard ‘Sensitive Sites’
headline.print_headline: France Deploys Troops to Guard ‘Sensitive Sites’
